THIRTEEN MONTHS LATER, DECEMBER 30, 1902, THE PUBLISHING HOUSE WAS DESTROYED BY FIRE. THE CAUSE WAS NEVER DETERMINED, BUT EYEWITNESSES REPORT THAT THE WHOLE BUILDING SEEMED TO BURST INTO FLAMES ALMOST SIMULTANEOUSLY. WHEN INFORMED OF THIS DISASTER, ELLEN WHITE WROTE: "I WAS NOT SURPRISED BY THE SAD NEWS, FOR IN THE VISIONS OF THE NIGHT I HAVE SEEN AN ANGEL STANDING WITH A SWORD AS 
                                                                           532
OF FIRE STRETCHED OVER BATTLE CREEK."--TESTIMONIES, VOL. 8, P. 97.
